meanings.definition: Of or relating to the palate.
meanings.sent1: The chef's palpal creations delighted the taste buds.
meanings.sent2: The palpal sensation of the food lingered in her mouth.
meanings.sent3: The palpal dishes at the restaurant were a feast for the senses.
meanings.sent4: The palpal flavors danced on her tongue like a symphony.
meanings.sent5: The palpal experience of the meal was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A small, fleshy projection on the palate.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the patient's palpal for any abnormalities.
meanings.sent2: She could feel a tiny palpal at the back of her mouth.
meanings.sent3: The palpal wiggled comically when she tried to speak.
meanings.sent4: The palpal was as delicate as a petal on a flower.
meanings.sent5: The palpal was sensitive to even the slightest touch.

meanings.definition: To touch or feel with the hands.
meanings.sent1: She palpaled the fabric to check its quality.
meanings.sent2: He palpaled the fruit to see if it was ripe.
meanings.sent3: The child palpaled the toy with curiosity.
meanings.sent4: She palpaled the rough texture of the wall.
meanings.sent5: He palpaled the softness of the puppy's fur.
